DOC.brief_summary: The objective study assess safety effectiveness Journey Deuce Bicompartmental Knee System 4-6 week , 4 month , 1 year , 2 year compare total knee replacement use Genesis II Total Knee System . The hypothesis Journey Deuce Bicompartmental Knee System safe effective Genesis II Total Knee System 2-year . The null hypothesis difference group .
DOC.brief_title: Functional Performance Journey Deuce Bicompartmental Versus Genesis II Total Knee System
DOC.criteria: Patient present noninflammatory degenerative joint disease medial patellofemoral compartment require unilateral knee replacement . Patient 30 65 year age , inclusive . Patient willing consent participate study sign date IRBapproved consent form . Patient plan available followup 2 year postoperative . Patient known insufficient femoral tibial bone stock result condition cancer , distal femoral/proximal tibial osteotomy , significant osteoporosis metabolic bone disorder . Patient immunosuppressed , autoimmune disorder , immunosuppressive disorder ( i.e . chronic condition characterize markedly inhibited ability respond antigenic stimulus . ) Examples condition include patient immunosuppressive therapy ( corticosteroid hormone large amount , cytotoxic drug , antilymphocytic serum irradiation large dos ) patient acquire immunodeficiency syndrome ( AIDS ) . Patient inflammatory arthritis ( e.g . rheumatoid arthritis ) Patient BMI > 35 . Patient major knee surgery past i.e . HTO , unicondylar knee replacement , fail fracture fixation . Patient active infection , local systemic . Patient physical , emotional neurological condition would compromise patient 's compliance postoperative rehabilitation followup ( e.g . : drug alcohol abuse , serious mental illness , general neurological condition Parkinson , Multiple sclerosis , etc. ) . Patient ACL deficiency study knee . Patient hip arthritis and/or replacement . Patient lateral compartment disease . Patient pregnant plan become pregnant course study . Patient workman 's compensation . Patient known sensitivity material device .
